item.title: Colleen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Colleen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows. No man has a right to bring up his children without surrounding them with books, if he has the means to buy them. It is a wrong to his family. He cheats them! Children learn to read by being in the presence of books. The love of knowledge comes with reading and grows upon it." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Colleen add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Christopher Buckley
item.description: "That's the beauty of argument, if you argue correctly, you're never wrong." -- Christopher Buckley

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Research is formalized curiosity. It is poking and prying with a purpose." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Karen Abbott
item.description: "Leave the fireworks for those who cast no spark of their own." -- Karen Abbott
